Rachel Lang.Action: Pleading with her mother to play, showing desire for connection despite rejection.
Calls 9-1-1 to get help for her mother, showing concern and responsibility.
Repeatedly tries to get her mother's attention despite being ignored and even getting brush paint in the face.
Deliberately uses a toy ambulance to trigger its siren and attempts to dial 9-1-1 to get help for her mother despite her young age and physical difficulty reaching the buttons.
Repeatedly tries to get her mother’s attention and engage her to stop harmful behavior, demonstrating persistence and situational awareness.
Physically tugs on her mother’s arm to gain attention but is rebuffed with a paint splash to the face.
Calls out to her mother and tries to go to her despite being held back, shows concern and attachment.
Refuses to go to a 'nice family' and breaks free from the policeman, demonstrating mistrust but also strong will to stay in familiar surroundings.
Cradles her puppy, finds comfort and shows tenderness toward her pet.

Avoids confrontation by mumbling apologies and lowering eyes rather than defending herself.
Makes a sarcastic face in response to a rude comment but still answers politely.

Engages in casual, confident conversation with peers; recognizes a situation quickly ('Oh, my gawd. You did it.') and shares a private joke with Lisa, showing social intelligence and ease.

Turns and stops dead when the door handle jiggles; backs into the living room and spins as tapping and jiggling continue; puts her palms against her temples as if struggling internally; answers the phone despite the strange call; confronts the intimidating voice on the phone by asking questions; grabs a knife and retreats toward the bedroom while planning to call the police.
